videos.alt_text: Sabrina Carpenter Ft. Jenna Ortega - Taste
videos.title: Sabrina Carpenter Ft. Jenna Ortega - Taste (2024)
videos.description: In Sabrina Carpenter's music video for "Taste," co-starring Jenna Ortega, the duo engage in a gory, darkly comedic rivalry over a two-timing boyfriend. Directed by Dave Meyers, the video features numerous campy horror and cult film references, including scenes inspired by Death Becomes Her and Kill Bill. Carpenter and Ortega repeatedly murder each other in elaborate ways, including stabbings, voodoo dolls, and falls from great heights, only to make up with a kiss. In collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Lizzy Walker.

videos.title: AJ Tracey - Bubble Bath (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Bubble Bath" by AJ Tracey, released in 2024, is set in a lively West London nail shop, directed by LateMilk. The video features vibrant, energetic scenes that reflect the song's upbeat and catchy vibe. It highlights the fusion of contemporary urban culture with playful, colorful visuals, showcasing AJ Tracey in various stylish setups, interacting with people in the nail shop, and performing the song with charisma and flair. The setting and visuals create a fun, engaging atmosphere that complements the track's infectious rhythm and lyrics.

videos.title: Her Morning Elegance (2009)
videos.description: A collaborative stop motion film by musician Oren Lavie and Israeli photographer Eyal Landesman. The only stop-motion video to ever earn a grammy nomination, this whimsical video accompanies the song of same name by Lavie. The camera remains stationary while bedroom linens and clothing move across the mattress as personifications of the birds, trains, and fish she dreams of.

videos.title: Adidas - Feel the Boost (2019)
videos.description: 2019 commercial for adidas from director and cinematographer Dani Abelló, featuring fast-paced ground-level running sequences throughout. Created by agency 72andSunny and produced by Somesuch and Anonymous. You're seeing an overhead fixed camera shot. Overhead doesn't always mean the shot is always high up, and this shot is classified as 'fixed camera' instead of tracking because the camera is fixed to the body. You might also consider this a 'first-person pov' as though one was looking down at their legs while running.

videos.title: Usher, H.E.R. - Risk It All (2024)
videos.description: In the 2024 music video 'Risk It All' directed by Dave Meyers, Usher and H.E.R. deliver an emotionally charged performance, underscored by contemporary dance, on a rotating platform in a dimly lit setting. The video, known for its sophisticated yet steamy ambiance, culminates in a poignant moment with Usher tearfully singing the final note. This collaboration is a standout part of 'The Color Purple' soundtrack, showcasing the artistic depth and vulnerability of both artists.

videos.title: Yung Jake - Unfollow (2014)
videos.description: "Unfollow" by Yung Jake, presented on MOCAtv, explores the challenge of moving on from a past relationship in the digital era, emphasizing the difficulty of severing ties through social media. The music video captures the emotional turmoil and the haunting presence of past memories amplified by social media feeds. It artistically portrays the struggle of detaching from a former partner in a world where digital connections persistently remind one of the past.

videos.title: Jhula - Manish Khushalani (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Jhula" by Manish Khushalani, released in 2024, explores themes of vulnerability, trust, and the delicate nature of relationships. The video combines Indian classical elements with contemporary electronic music, creating a unique visual and auditory experience. The narrative is driven by a series of intimate and evocative scenes that reflect the song's emotional depth, showcasing a blend of traditional and modern aesthetics that highlight the fusion of cultural influences. The visuals are crafted to complement the haunting melody and poignant lyrics, making for a captivating and immersive experience.

videos.title: Her Morning Elegance (2009)
videos.description: A collaborative stop motion film by musician Oren Lavie and Israeli photographer Eyal Landesman. The only stop-motion video to ever earn a grammy nomination, this whimsical video accompanies the song of same name by Lavie. The camera remains stationary while bedroom linens and clothing move across the mattress as personifications of the birds, trains, and fish she dreams of.

videos.alt_text: adidas Originals - Original Is Never Finished
videos.title: adidas Originals - Original Is Never Finished (2018)
videos.description: The second installment of the now iconic Original is Never Finished campaign. This shot would be categorized as an overhead stop motion duplication conveyor shot to cut-in. A cut-in is literally when we "cut-in" from a wider shot to a closer shot. It's a staple of Wes Anderson and Edgar Wright. The stop-motion in this scene is subtle but enough to be catalogued.

The hope is for humanity to strive through all of this in a meaningful and positive way.
